metadata.title: CVE-2012-6655 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue exists AccountService 0.6.37 in theuser_change_password_authorized_cb() function in user.c which could let alocal users obtain encrypted passwords.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

accountsservice - 22.07.5-2ubuntu1.5
gir1.2-accountsservice-1.0 - 22.07.5-2ubuntu1.5
libaccountsservice0 - 22.07.5-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: accountsservice package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '22.07.5-2ubuntu1.5').
